Lastly, we are very excited to let you and other readers know that we've been in the process of upgrading/updating our guest rooms.  We're replacing beds, adding bed 'toppers' for added comfort, upgraded linens and towls, new carpet/drapes, updated bathroom counters, etc, etc.  Take a look at our website as we've loaded the most recent photos.  We have 1 floor completed and will be working on the next three floors throughout the summer.  You'll find on your next visit to the Holiday Inn Buena Park that our rooms will hardly be able to be called 'economy' -- please let us know how you like them.  We sincerely do appreciate guest comments and suggestions -- especially when given directly to front desk and/or management during your stay, so that we are able to quickly and efficiently resolve them -- allowing you to fully enjoy your vacation or trip to California.  Warm regards, Melissa and the team at the Holiday Inn Buena Park

Summary: We stayed in a non-smoking room on the ground floor next to the pool. The room was quiet and comfortable, If you want peace, ask for a poolside room, as the rooms on the outside have busy roads around them. We also paid $10 a day for a small refrigerator, which was excellent. One word of warning, the people on either side of us who were in non smoking rooms, used the patio area outside to smoke. This drifted into our room through the air con. We checked with the front desk and they confirmed that non smoking included the patio areas. They had to send security down twice to get the neighbours to stop smoking. But the Front Desk were very courteous and discounted my bill at check out.  This is an ideal hotel if you are going to Disney & Knotts Berry Farm. The Courtesy bus is very
Manager Response: none

Summary: we stayed at this hotel  for 5 nights as part of our Virgin Golden Triangle tour and found it all to be good. It was clean, the room was basic but the beds were very comfortable. The sheets and towels would be changed daily if required. The pool was lovely and warm with plenty of towels for guests to use. We didnt eat in the hotel as there are loads of eating places very close by, it is in a good central location for all the Anaheim attractions which are easy to get to if you have a car. We checked in easily in a few minutes and the reception staff were always helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here around 1 year ago and as a result of my previous good stay, returned!  I came from the UK.  I am from the UK and even though this is a relatively good value hotel, the mere fact that I come from the UK makes it an expensive break!    When we arrived after our 12 hour flight there was a delay in obtaining our room and the room that we eventually got was not horrible but was just in need of some attention.  The bed clothes had holes in, the furniture was dated and worn and the bathroom needed some attention.  I think I was more so disappointed as I tend to book what I know, I know Holiday Inn as a brand and having stayed here before coming from the UK, I was looking forward to a nice break.  During this trip I proposed to my partner and was looking forward to having
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked our room through Priceline for $55 ($64 with taxes).  This was a three star hotel for them.  We feel its more a 2 1/2 star.  We wanted to spend a couple days in the Knotts Berryfarm area before going on a cruise.  Hotel is nice.  Could use a little better cleaning.  Staff is friendly and efficient.  Beds in rooms are good and linen is not thread bear.  Bathroom is small.  TV has a lot of channels.  Did not eat in hotel.  Parking is plentiful.  Hotel location is great.  Lots of restaurants nearby and Knotts Berryfarm is less than a mile away as are many other tourist sites.  Takes about 40 minutes to get to hotel from LAX and is right off State 91.  For $55 base rate, this is an excellent value.
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us.  We wanted to let you know that we are currently in process of several upgrades throughout the hotel, that will hopefully boost your opinion of our star rating, including: new pillowtops on beds in all guest rooms, new towels in all bathrooms, upgraded linens and comforters starting on floors 3 and 4, but we will quickly be placing them in all guestrooms.  We've also converted 2 smoking floors to non-smoking based on guest comments such as yours.  We are excited about the changes we've made, as well as those to come.  And we will continue to focus on the basics, such as cleanliness of our guestrooms and public areas, as you mentioned.    Please keep in mind we are a full service hotel with restaurant, bar and room service, kids eat free at all Holiday Inn's, which is an added bonus for families, and we do have the largest outdoor heated pool in the area! Thank you for comments and allowing us to serve you during your stay.

Summary: My Grandaughter and I stayed here in Nov 2007, we loved this hotel, although we were mildly amused to find that we had no refrigerator in the room ,but could hire one for 10 dollars a day, so our pumpkin pie got a trifle soft. We liked the convenience to The medieval times, pirates show and ripleys believe it or not which were all within walking distance There was a very good shopping mall also within walking distance which had numerous eating places  close by.All up a very enjoyable stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was the first place we stayed in our golden triangle trip - when you think holiday inn, you think basic!!!  This was actually the better of the hotels we stayed in!  The staff are all friendly and helpful - there are enough staff on hand all the time so you are never waiting in a line of people.    The rooms were huge, we had the most amazingly comfortable bed, lovely bathroom, nice quiet location!!!  The location was great, we had a car so being 20 minutes of out LA wasn't a problem and it also gave us the opportunity to explore a little more!!! I would definately recommend you hire a car for LA - otherwise there is so much you could miss out on! As for location of the hotel you have Knotts Berry Farm within the mile and also Downtown Disney so there is so much to
Manager Response: Kat&John, Thank you for your comments, and we're glad that you appreciate the free wireless internet access available to our guests.  We are assuming that based on your comments, you were placed on a smoking floor/wing - possibly due to high occupancies and booking through a 3rd party source (when you don't book directly through the hotel via phone or website, room types aren't always guaranteed).  We do have a plan in place, due to the high demand for non-smoking rooms to reduce the number of smoking rooms/floors in the hotel that will alleviate concerns such as yours.  We have also recently implemented  a new room service program geared towards ensuring trays are picked up regularly. As management, we want to let you know that we do listen (and read) your comments and concerns - that's how we learn to be and serve better.  Our only request is that you let us know prior to your departure so that we can ensure your stay is as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. We look forward to your next visit. Warm regards,  Holiday Inn Buena Park Management and Staff

Summary Heading: Good Location, property is getting a little tired and smelly
Summary: This hotel looks like it was a really nice place in the 80's.  The lobby and entrance are ok and there are a lot of meeting rooms.  My room was in a detached building that appeared to have little security for access.  The room was what you'd expect in a Holiday Inn, but perhaps a bit more dingy.  Room service trays on the floor in the hallway during the entire visit.  Wireless internet worked very well.  Based upon west coast hotels, $75 or less would be a reasonable rate.  Any more and there are better options very close.
Manager Response: Kat&John, Thank you for your comments, and we're glad that you appreciate the free wireless internet access available to our guests.  We are assuming that based on your comments, you were placed on a smoking floor/wing - possibly due to high occupancies and booking through a 3rd party source (when you don't book directly through the hotel via phone or website, room types aren't always guaranteed).  We do have a plan in place, due to the high demand for non-smoking rooms to reduce the number of smoking rooms/floors in the hotel that will alleviate concerns such as yours.  We have also recently implemented  a new room service program geared towards ensuring trays are picked up regularly. As management, we want to let you know that we do listen (and read) your comments and concerns - that's how we learn to be and serve better.  Our only request is that you let us know prior to your departure so that we can ensure your stay is as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. We look forward to your next visit. Warm regards,  Holiday Inn Buena Park Management and Staff

Summary: I have stayed at this Holiday Inn 4 or 5 times.  I book it when I take my kids to Knotts. (Book the the three star hotel in Buena Park for $50- 60 on Priceline and you will get this hotel)  I would not stay here otherwise.    The overall customer service at this hotel is good, although we were left a few times at the restaurant for 15 or 20 minutes waiting for the server to pick up the check when we needed change.   I had to hunt down anyone to help us at all when we entered the restaurant twice.  The free meals for the kids is a big plus, especially in an area near Knotts and Disney and the servers are generally nice. (There are much nicer hotels in the Disney area and deals can still be found).   The hotel is old and needs to be updated.  The toiletries and towels are better
Manager Response: Dear'Cruiser39'- Thank you so much for recognizing our overall great service levels.  We certainly strive to exceed our guests' expectations in service and peformance.   We would, however, like to address your concerns.  We have recognized during busy periods, such as when you visited, that we must have additional staffing, especially in the restaurant so that our levels of service and cleanliness meet/exceed those in the rest of the hotel.  We also know that, as you stated, the Kids Eat Free program is a huge benefit and a great way for families to add value to their vacation. In regards to the bathroom amenitites, you'll be happy (as we are) to know that we've upgraded to the Garden Botanica line of amenities, new shower heads, curved shower rods,   and we are in the process of upgrading our linens (including towels) to a thicker, plusher terry.  This is to be complete within the next 90 days.  We are excited about our new bath experience, as i'm sure guests such as yourself will be.   We are also beginning the process of upgrading our bed linens - this will create a fresh, contemporary new look in our guest rooms, in addition to that in our bathrooms.  Some of our beds, as you commented, are firm.  Many guests like firm mattresses, and many like softer mattresses -- from a hotel perspective we strive to please all of our guests (which can be difficult).  We have, however, decided to place 'pillow-toppers' on the mattresses that will enable us to meet the great majority of guest expectations in regards to bed comfort.  These should all be in place within the next 30 days.    As you can see, we are in the process of a major face-lift!  We have learned through conversations and comments such as yours where we need to spend out time, engery (and $$) to ensure that your future stays are as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.  We certainly appreciate your comments and encourage you (and others) to talk to us personally during your stay if there is anything that we can do to make your visit more enjoyable.  Warm regards, Traycee, Melissa and the entire team at Holiday Inn Buena Park Hotel & Conference Center

Summary Heading: Average Hotel w/ Below Average Room
Summary: I wanted to comment on my recent stay at the Holiday Inn.  I had called the morning of the day that I was to check in to inform them that I would be checking in late (we didn't arrive until 12 midnight), and they said that they would make a note of it. Well, I guess the note was for them to give me the last and worst possible room.  I guess I should have requested a non-smoking when I first called, however, I have never had a problem in the past.  Once we got to our floor, I realized that it was smoking rooms, well, because it reeked the odor of smoke!  We entered our room and I immediately called the front desk to see if we could transfer to a non-smoking room.  They were so kind to inform me that they were fully-booked for the evening, however, they would take note, once
Manager Response: NVDeeJay - thank you for your post.  First, we apologize that you didn't enjoy your guestroom, as a non-smoker myself, I don't appreciate smelling smoke in my living area.  Our hotel is made up of 80% non-smoking rooms, unfortunately when we are in a sold out situation, as we often are throughout summer, guests who do not reserve non-smoking rooms may get placed in smoking accommodations.  In regards to the front desk agent not following up, that is inexcusable and our front office manager will be addressing this concern directly with her staff. We do pride ourselves not only on the quality of our hotel, but the quality of the service we provide - our goal is to exceed guest expectations.  We sincerely apologize we failed you during your stay.  Please know that this is not our normal level of service and we certainly hope that you will give us a chance to show you how great we, at the Holiday Inn Buena Park, can be.  Warm regards, Melissa Bruckler

Summary: The hotel is situated right off the Highway 91, so one side of the hotel is subject to freeway noise.  I stayed on the 4th floor (executive floor?) and had access to a very simple and hearty hot and cold breakfast buffet on that floor.  Not sure if this is available to all guests, but ask.  My initial experience with front desk staff was rushed and impersonal, but I did manage to speak with one attentive employee who was able to move me from a noisy freeway-side room to a quieter pool-side room. Internet access at the hotel was wireless and complimentary (plus-plus!)  The hotel also had complimentary shuttles to/from DIsneyland and Knott's Berry Farm.  The hotel also had access to tours of other attractions (e.g. Getty Centre in LA).  My room had a King with a pull-out couch
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just got back last Sunday.  The hotel overall is ok.  There were 3 of us in a room.  We were given a smoking room and of course we dont smoke.  The smell bothered us. My son had to sleep on a sofa bed and was uncomfortable.  What prompt me to write was the inconvenience of the shuttle to the Disney area.  Pay close attention to their drop off and pick up times.  They do change daily.  If you dont make reservations then you must wait til the passengers who did get on first. If there is room then you may board the shuttle.  They make no exceptions for you either.  We were leaving back home on a Sunday afternoon and wanted to go shopping at Downtown Disney in the morning. Our schedule did not agree with theirs and they refused to pick us up.  We had reservations for dinner at the
Manager Response: Dear 'Disappointed' We apologize that you were checked into a smoking room when you prefer a non-smoking room. The majority of our rooms are non-smoking, so please do request a non-smoking room when making your next reservation -- we do try our very best to give guests their preference in room type upon checkin if we know ahead of time. You mentioned our shuttle service.  It is difficult to ensure every guest is able to get to and return from Disneyland and Knotts at the exact time they want to (with 248 guest rooms) - however, we do understand your frustration.  The transportation schedule we have developed is our attempt at satisfying the needs of many guests and getting them to Disney and the local attractions as efficiently as possible.  Trying to meet the needs of some customers, it seems, inconveniences other -- please know that we do try our very best to meet and exceed our guests' expectations and we sincerely apologize that we failed to do so in your case.  We do hope that you give us the opportunity in the future to prove ourselves again to you (and, as you said, save the $200-$300 you would spend staying in Anaheim).  Warm regards, Melissa Bruckler

Summary: We booked this through an Alaska airlines deal. I emailed the hotel and requested a pool view room per a review on tripadvisor. We were booked into the room overlooking the pool and the hotel and staff were awesome! I did not think it was inconvienent at all to Disneyland. In fact I thought the exact opposite. Anyway, we had a blast, the pool area is wonderful, the staff and rooms are great and we would have no problem staying here again. It is right across from Target and Dennys and there is a subway in the parking lot adjacent to the hotel as well as a coffee shop.

Summary Heading: Nice, but somewhat inconvenient if going to Disneyland

Nice and clean, but a bit small and the bathroom was similar to what you would find in an older Holiday Inn Express - Plain, white, small.  The beds were pretty standard for two to three star hotels, OK if you prefer hard beds.  Our room overlooked the lobby roof, but at least we weren't on the freeway offramp side, which I hear is noisy.  The hotel is sandwiched between a freeway and a very busy roads, so don't expect a peaceful environment when you go outside.    Ate in the restaraunt twice.  Food is pretty

We ate at the hotel restaurant and we liked it.  The kids ate free...so with two adults we usually ended up spending around $20 (tip included).  The hotel has a nice workout area...two treadmills, two bikes and some weight machines.  The pool was really nice and my kids had a great time playing in there. The parking lot is a bit tricky to get in and out of, but for the most part, easy to navigate.  If you are interested in Knotts Berry Farm, you are only a mile or so away from the main gate.  The rooms were extremely clean, the beds were comfortable, and the television had an alarming number of channels and pay-per-view movies.  For the weary business traveler, it was definitely a nice stop.

On the advice of a TripAdvisor member, I requested a room not facing the freeway and the front desk had already reserved a nice room overlooking the courtyard.   The room was very nice and clean.  It was very quiet also.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  We were traveling with two kids age 3 and 1, and I felt better than usual about letting them crawl around on a hotel room floor, because it was that clean. Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked this hotel room via Priceline to attend a convention in nearby Cerritos. My room was nice and clean, but faced the freeway and looked down on the offramp, which had a traffic light.  The sounds of braking and accelerating were pretty constant.  Restaurants looked good, but did not eat on the premises.  There were too many nicer restaurants in the area.  Parking was a  problem during the day, not at night.  Access in and out of the hotel was difficult because of the dividers in the street.  Overall, this is not a bad hotel, if you stay on the north side away from the freeway.

Summary: For the price this hotel cannot be beaten. We have stayed here at least 8 times and love it. The position is good, the rooms have everything you need and the pool area is excellent. The front desk staff were very effecient and I had no problem picking up a package that had arrived at the hotel for me ahead of time.    This hotel is right off of Highway 90, about 2 blocks to Knotts Berry Farm and 15 minutes to Disneyland. Summary: I stayed with my mom at the Holiday Inn Buena Park for mother’s day. Hotel is very nice and clean with a nice outdoor pool area; and the staff is very friendly, I was amazed about how many things I was able to do with my mom in Buena Park, just a block away from the hotel is Medieval Times Restaurant, Knott’s Berry farms is on same street just a few blocks away, everything is just around the corner, Target (for those who travel with limited personal stuff), gas station, nice restaurants, bus pick up for Disneyland in site. I enjoyed my stay at this Hotel and if I ever returned to CA I would definitely stay there again. I highly recommend this hotel.

Summary: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for a quick family holiday - great location, minutes to all of the attractions. Anyway, the bellmen were also nice - always on time with the shuttles (that were Free!).  Great pool and food was good in the restaurant -- love that kids eat free.  All in all - we will definitely return.

I'd stay at this property again.  Stuart Andersons Black Angus is directly across street....check it out, very good.

Upon arrival, I was told they were full and they would have to put us up for the night elsewhere. Summary Heading: Outdated, Dirty Hotel with Poor Service
Summary: My wife and I stayed at this property during a recent visit to Disneyland.  We got the room on a Hotwire bid.  The room was not clean (carpets were dirty - debris, dust and hair could be seen when the matress was moved to the side.  Weight room was outdated with broken equipment.   Pool water was cloudy and on two nights there were NO towels; trash including pizza boxes  could be seen in the pool area.  I would not recommend this hotel to anybody.  It is outdated, unkempt and certainly not up to Holiday Inn standards. I will be writing a formal comlaint letter to Holiday Inn, Inc. about our experience.
Manager Response: The outdated broken gym equipment is simply not true.  The guest might have us confused with another hotel.  We have lovely double bay fitness center with a brand new treadmill and well maintained universal weight equipment, bicycles, rowing machine and more.  These guests did stay in the middle of Spring Break and even though we have a full staff washing pool towels 24 hours a day- it is during that time of year that we do have some hiccups in keeping ahead of so many guests.  We have ordered 5,000 more towels to try and help with this issue as well as additional staff hired for the pool and public areas during the summer.  We are proud to say that we do meet and greatly exceed Holiday Inn standards.

Manager Response: We apologize for the inconvenience.  During the Month of April we were going through a major systems change and were short staffed. Foyer is enormous, with sweeping marble, and beauty, a fulltime concierge, etc and lovely grounds and gardens,  Staff is very professional and helpful.  They try nicely. Summary: We stayed here for our summer vacation due to our Priceline bid. We knew it wouldn't be extravagant, for the price we were fine with that. We figured we would hardly be in the hotel any how. Check-in was a nightmare. We had to wait an hour-and-a-half to finally get a room! With three small children and a full lobby, it was a nightmare! The lobby was nice. The hallways were dark, not very clean. Our room was dirty, there was trash and a pill under the bed! There was a fairly big hole under the sink, and the water was cold. We will never stay here again! We were so glad to leave when we continued our vacation in San Diego at the Omni, in this case we got what we paid for.

Inside this small room, a cubicle (advertising Seaworld) has been constructed, stuffed inside the cubicle are a set of narrow bunkbeds, a narrow twin and a chest with a TV(which did not work). The door is a curtain and the walls are thin board which do not reach the ceiling. Outside the cubicle is a queen bed, an armoire, a fridge, a desk and a table with two chairs. This suite sleeps five, but it is so stuffed with furniture that it is difficult for one person to move around. It does not work for a
Manager Response: We apologize that your expectations were not met during your recent stay with us at the Holiday Inn Buena Park.  As advertised on our website, the KidsSuite is a very "cozy" room and designed for 3 young children.  We are very specific in our selling description that it is a standard sized room and not your typical "suite."    We strive to exceed all of our guest expectations and deliver a quality service experience.  We would have loved to have had contact with you during your stay regarding your concerns, so that we could have replaced the TV and/or relocated you to a room that suited your needs.  We understand that the KidsSuite is not convenient for every family, especially those with older children who require more space.  Please don't hesitate to contact us upon booking your next reservation in the area as we would like to ensure that the true high level of service and amenities that our repeat guests have enjoyed for many years.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay here so much, we came back again!! The staff are awesome - be sure to have a chat and a drink with the bartender... very cool! Also, we found that the Bell Captain went above and beyond his job to assist us with everything. Truly the most professional staff, with clean tidy rooms, and the most accomodating staff I have ever met. I am looking forward to our return trip already!

Summary Heading: High quality for a low price
Summary: I was quite pleased with my stay here from 08/06 through 08/08.  I booked the room through hotwire for $48/night and received quite a bargain upon arrival.  The location was prime, however, we were assigned a handicapped room since every other room was booked up for that particular weekend.  The staff was quite friendly and the pool/hot tub were nice.  We did not try their restaurant, but I'm confident it was of high quality based on appearance.  I would certainly exercise the option of staying here again if the opportunity presented itself, but would prefer a normal room as opposed to a handicapped.  Thanks!

Summary: A nice hotel. My wife and I stayed here in September 04 and found it to be clean and comfortable but a fridge in the room would be nice. Staff are helpful and friendly. It has a very pleasant bar and a lovely restaurant. A courtesy bus will take you to Disney Land and Knotts berry farm theme park, which are nearby. It also has a screened off swimming pool. We did not have any kids with us so we didn’t do the theme parks but the bell captain can arrange any tours that you may wish to take. The only thing I would say is that any trip you wish to take is going to involve quite a bit of time and more than a few miles e.g., downtown LA is about 40 minutes to an hour away depending on traffic.

My only grip was I called to ask for more towels and the maid knocked on the door with one towel. A sick woman with 2 kids and a dad need more than 3 towles!I actually had to call the front desk again and recieve permission for more towels.
